column4: Wow, I really am stoked.  This is really impressive guys.  UBUNTU on my Powerbook ... really rockin' !!!!!
it's the same for the installation on my girlfriend's powerbook :))
right, but single user and text mode are not the same.. :)
no, apt-get won't do it for you
so i have to make /lib/modules/`uname -r`/build as well, right?
don't know if you do not use the debian way
are you trying to compile the kernel, aren't you? why not install kernel-package and o it the simpliest way (debian.way) ?
install the sources, they are in the /usr/src dir
i did that, but it still doesn't make the symlinks that are needed
for me only /usr/src/linux are usually needed
if you unzip than you have also to untar

i'm trying to install the Mac-On-Linux modules so that i can run OSX and Linux concurrently.  it requires the linux kernel sources to be installed and set up on the system.  i installed linux-sources-2.6.8.1, unbzip'ed the file in /usr/src, made the symlink by hand.
what error do you get? then?
check #flood, i'll re-paste the errors i get when i try to compile the MOL module.
